fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49713].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two different calendars, Calendar1 and Calendar2
# Create a new page
# Insert a Team Calendar macro and choose "Add Existing Macro"
# Choose *only* Calendar1 and click "Add"
# Edit the created macro
# Place your cursor in the "Calendar" field to search for Calendar2

h4. Expected Results
The search should show Calendar2 

h4. Actual Results
An error is shown: "No calendars with Calendar2"

h4. Workaround
After placing your cursor in the Calendar field as mentioned in Step 6 above, press "Backspace" to delete one space and try to search the calendar. The search should be working now
fields.summary: Searching for a calendar in the calendar macro adds an extra space when you edit the macro - this results in not being able to find calendars because it's searching for an extra space

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49707].
  {panel}

Problem: 
When embedding JIRA issue dates, if there is a JIRA issue with just a date field (e.g. Due Date), it does not render in a helpful way in the timeline view:
!http://cl.ly/image/3H3F3y2k0w0I/Image%202014-05-22%20at%202.45.49%20pm.png!

When you click:
!http://cl.ly/image/2N2Q2O0W3d0Z/Image%202014-05-22%20at%202.46.27%20pm.png!

Solution:
For single dates (like issue due date), we should show them like we show JIRA versions (the full lozenge, but with a arrow down to the actual date)

This bug was reported by [~rebecca.odette] during a customer interview

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49684].
  {panel}

When a user move issues on a JIRA calendar those changes are not being replicated to other users in a timely manner. 

How to replicate:

# Create a JIRA calendar inside a page in Confluence with user1
# Open that same page with user2
# Move issues on that calendar with user1
# Refresh calendar with user2, no changes can be seen.
# Add (or remove) due date to an issue in JIRA, that change does not get replicated to the calendar.

If you move issues with user2, user1 wont see those changes promptly as well, even if on JIRA the due dates are correct. This same behavior applies to issues that had a resolution set and should be grayed out, some users see it, some users don't.

Also, when setting Due Date on an issue that issue doesn't show up on the users calendar as well, but if a new calendar is created the same shows up. 

This can lead to serious problems as users can edit calendars at the same time and completely lost track of what is actually happening to the due dates of their JIRA issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49675].
  {panel}

h6. Problem description

It seems that regular events are inheriting permissions from JIRA events inside a Team Calendar.

h6. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new Calendar in Confluence and two events of type: Event and JIRA Issue Dates. 
# Configure the "JIRA Issue Dates" event to use a JIRA filter that is restricted to your user. 
# Create a few events in the Calendar just to populate it (for testing purposes).
# Access Confluence with a different user (that's it's not the owner of the JIRA filter) and go to Team Calendars. 
# Click "Add Existing Calendar" and add the calendar created previously.

h6. What should be happening
You should be able to see regular events within the Calendar but not the ones related to JIRA (because the JIRA filter is restricted to the user that set up the Calendar in the first place).

h6. What is currently happening
You see nothing. No events are displayed at all. Plus, it appears that the Calendar doesn't contain any events, if you look at the calendar name at the right, you'll see no events under its name. *However*, if you create a new event (of any type) inside the calendar, suddenly, all regular events start showing up (once again, the ones you should be able to see in the first place and not the ones related to JIRA), and if you delete the event you just created, all events continue to appear in the calendar, but if you remove and re-add the calendar, the problem happens again, no events at all.
fields.summary: Calendar events seems to be inheriting permissions from JIRA events
Team Calendars Upcoming Events popup windows shows wrong dates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49672].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Summary    
Sometimes watchers of a page containing an embedded calendar will receive notifications if a completely different calendar has been updated

h2. Details
When a user updates a calendar (i.e. adds a new event), it seems that Team Calendars will look for pages (via Lucene index) that have the calendar embedded by searching for the calendarId. Watchers of all these pages will then receive a notification email from Team Calendars.

The problem is that the calendarId search is not accurate. Consider the following Confluence search:
{code}
embeddedSubCalendarId:83ded06a-f3ce-4639-a431-a807c9926fc9
{code}
Instead of searching for that entire unbroken string, it seems that Lucene is breaking this into smaller pieces, delimitated by the hyphen. This can be demonstrated by trial-and-error or via an utility like [Luke|http://www.semanticmetadata.net/2013/04/11/luke-4-2-binaries] to examine the index:

!use_the_force.png|height=300px!  


As a result, pages that embed completely different calendars that happen to match any of the pieces will come back in the search, and watchers of those pages will receive an unintended notification. 

h2. Steps to reproduce
I tested this with Confluence 5.4.1 + Team Calendars 4.1.4 

# Create 2 calendars, Calendar A and Calendar B, and make note of their calendarId values (Grab it from Down arrow > Share/embed)
# Create a page and embed Calendar A onto it. Make note of the pageId (Edit the page and grab it from the URL)
# Add a user who is not watching any of the calendars as a Watcher of this page
# In the database, locate those page contents in the BODYCONTENT table, and replace part of the Id of Calendar A with a part of Calendar B. The result will be an invalid calendarId, but that's fine for the purposes of this test. I used MySQL to test, your query may vary:
{code:sql}
UPDATE BODYCONTENT
SET body = REPLACE(body, '<part_of_calendar_a>', '<part_of_calendar_b>')
WHERE contentid = '<pageId>';
{code}
# Rebuild index (Confluence Admin > Content Indexing)
# Add an event to Calendar B

h4. Expected result
Page watcher in step 3 will not receive a notification

h4. Actual result
Page watcher in step 3 receives notification, because the test page contains part of the Id of Calendar B.
fields.summary: Team Calendars erroneously sends out notification emails to users not watching it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49671].
  {panel}

When adding a 'JIRA Issue Dates' event and selecting a 'Saved Filer' or 'JQL', if, within this date picker custom field configurations the issue type context is set to one or more specific issue type instead the 'Any issue type', this custom date picker field does not appear as a selectable option neither on 'Single Date' nor on 'Date range'.

h4.Steps to reproduce
# Create a date picker custom field
# Change its application issue type context to a specific issue type
# Add en event to a team calendar
# Select 'JIRA Issue Dates' as the 'Event type'
# Select 'Saved Filter' or 'JQL' as 'Display'
# Apply a saved filter or a JQL
# You won't see this date picker field as a 'Single date' option or a 'Date range' option

h4.Workaround
If you can, don't use a specific issue type as an applicable context for this custom field. Set it to 'Any issue type'.

fields.summary: Error from subscribing to Office 365 Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49664].
  {panel}

Multiple people of our team encounter the problem that they get the 500error when viewing the team calendar (see attachment "Selection_189.png").
None of the previous selected calendars seems to be selected.
When trying to reselect all calendars the NPE in "Selection_190.png" is thrown.

This problem is encountered since (german) today.
fields.summary: HTTP 500 on Calendar view - NPE on add
Remove the dependency to AbstractWebDriverTest
Editing pages with Chrome not possible when Teamcal enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49658].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce : 
# Add a calendar event
# The Add event screen opens up with pre-filled start and end dates
# Verify the format, they have the same format
# Change the end date by picking up any date in the calendar
# Notice that the date is in a different format
fields.summary: When editing event start and end dates in other languages (E.g. French), the date format changes
Team Calendars exceptions while evaluating conditions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49655].
  {panel}

Both 'Prev' and 'Next' button labels in calendar view cannot be localized.
Please see my attached screenshot.

Best regards,
Kan Ogawa
fields.summary: 'Prev' and 'Next' button labels are hard-coded.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49653].
  {panel}

We have an evaluation of Confluence OnDemand Team calendar add-on running. We will be charged starting May 24th.

Today we wanted to end the evaluation. When trying to disable (unsubscribe), a security window pops up where I am supposed to enter a username and password (see screenshot).

We cannot deactivate the add-on now. Please disable the add-on so that we will not be charged for it.

Kind regards!
fields.summary: Cannot End Evaluation Period

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49652].
  {panel}

Setting up a 'JIRA Issue Dates' event on Team Calendars and choosing a data range including the 'Issue Created Date', while "resizing" and/or drag-and-dropping any issue on the calendar (which basically updates/changes the selected days on this issue) returns a JIRA permission error on the screen.

h4.Steps to reproduce:
# Have issues on JIRA
# Create a calendar on Confluence (or add it to an existing one)
# Add a 'JIRA Issues Date' event type showing a date range using the 'Created Date'
# Resize the end of the issue/Update the due date of the event
fields.summary: Unable to update any date field on Team Calendar using JIRA Issue Date event type
multiple event macros on a page doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49648].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.2
# Create a user
# Create a calendar
# Subscribe to the calendar as the user
# Create some events with the user as an attendee
# Delete the user (this can be done from the remote directory if you are using LDAP - the common customer use case, or directly through the db if the front end will not allow it)
# Try to view the calendar. You will see this error and stack trace:

h3. Workarounds
# Recreate the user, and resynch the directory to Confluence if required.
# Upgrade to Confluence 5.3

NB: This issue only appears to occur with Confluence 5.2.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when opening Calendar view after user is deleted
Race condition when loading calendars can cause errors (doInTransaction Unable to load events of sub-calendar)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49644].
  {panel}

Precondition
* Create a calendar and some events
* Hidden any one of events

Steps:
* Click on calendar's icon to show context menu
* Click on Refresh button

Actual
* The hidden event is unhidden

Expected:
* The hidden event is still hidden
* Update for unhidden events only 

Note
* As a user, I will click on this event to hide it again
fields.summary: All hidden events are unhidden after refreshing calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49642].
  {panel}

I removed the only calendar from my view and am not able to subscribe to any calendars anymore. 

I have admin rights.

I can see calendars embedded on confluence pages.

URL: http://hostname/calendar/mycalendar.action
All I see is $calendarHtml, Add Calendar button does nothing, there does not seem to be any registered events to the calendar button.

fields.summary: Can not subscribe to any calendars anymore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49640].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Calendar page or call \{calendar\} macro
# Select 'Add Calendar' button
# Add Existing Calendar
# Click 'search for calendars'

h4. Actual Result: 
The search does not return any results, and following appear in the logs:
{noformat}
2014-05-12 01:14:51,792 ERROR [http-9081-38] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.model.LightweightPersistentSubCalendar cannot be cast to
 com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.InternalSubscriptionCalendarDataStore$InternalSubscriptionSubCalendar
 -- url: /rest/quicknav/1/search | userName: kholmes | referer: https://extranet.atlassian.com/dashboard.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49633].
  {panel}

*Preconditions:*
* Login with admin user to create a new user called "qavn"
* Default language of local PC is English

*Steps*
* Login with "qavn" user
* Navigate to *Calendars* (click OK button to accept your Time Zone)
* Subscription an exist Calendar which have at least 1 events (ex. Kalendar)
* Create an event (ex. Event1)
* Go to settings then change to Deutsch language.
* Go to Calendars

*Actual:*
* It's NOT show *Event1*

*Expected:*
* It shows *Event1*

*Work around:*
* Create a new event (ex. event2)
* => It shows all event of this calendar
* Change language to English
* => It's not show any event of this calendar.

_Note:_
_Please refer to the attached file for more detail (it's .swf file, you can open it in IE or any flash players)_
fields.summary: Subscription Calendar not show events when User (not admin) changed language

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49632].

*Preconditions:*
* Current date is 2013-11-20
* Run JIRA and Confluence server on your local PC then change your system date-time to date 2011-10-14
* Created jira issues and jira release versions on JIRA server
* (This version is NOT release yet)
* Created jira issue and release version events on Team Calendar

*Steps:*
* Go to calendar screen (any view modes are OK) 
* Go to date 2011-10-14
* Click on a jira issue
* Observe the inline dialog

*Actual:*
* Remaining date is "Due to 37 days ago"

*Expected:*
* Remaining date is "Due to 768 days ago"

!Screen Shot 2013-11-20 at 1.09.22 PM.png!

_Notes:_
_If JIRA release version was released, it shows the release date => It's OK_
_Please refer to these attached files fore more details_

We are using team calendars to manage reservations for our meeting rooms.
Sometimes we need to know who has made a reservation.
The appointment creator is visibile only if the "who" field is populated
There is a way to always show who created the appointment.
Can we make the who field mandatory?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49598].
  {panel}

I am using Team Calendar along with the Zen Foundation Plugin and when we place a calendar on a secondary tab, it does not load when viewed. 

By this I mean If I have two tabs and I place the calendar in the second tab (the one that is not instantly loaded with the page). If I then click on the tab to view the calendar, it seems unable to actually load the calendar. 

If I click on the 'today' button or try to cycle through the months, it will load the events, but when you first click on the tab to see the calendar it just keeps trying to load it and nothing comes up. 

I tested this with a few different view options for the Calendar and they all did the same thing.
fields.summary: When Team Calendar is used with Zen Foundation and put in a secondary tab on a page it does not load when viewed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49597].
  {panel}

My users are getting a very strange mix of errors when trying to use team calendar, that make it unusable.

1) When my several developers go to Calendars, they are greeted with the error $calendarHtml

2) The others will see the calendar, but will not be able to add any existing calendars. The existing calendar lists will not be populated, and searching provides no results.

3) When deleting/removing a calendar, either by deleting the calendar from Confluence or by removing it from their view, users will get a 500 error (see screenshot).

I have noticed that calendar functionality with #2 may be linked to #3, as we were able to add calendars until one user removed several calendars, and then no more users who tried were able to add existing calendars.
fields.summary: Cannot view existing calendars, HTML Error, and 500 Error
calendar subscription doesnot work for MailChimp calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49594].
  {panel}

We recently implemented the ability to remember as many fields as possible if you switch event types

However, the main use case for this was I start with an event event 

and in the "What" field I write "holiday", but then I realise ahh, sorry that was supposed to be a "leave" event.

So I switch event types.. and what I wrote for "What" doesn't get carried over to "Summary"

Basically this request is to make sure if someone enters something in the  "what" field, then switches event types to leave/travel it gets carried across
fields.summary: The generic event "What" field should be the same field as "Summary" in leave/travel events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49590].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Confluence and Team Calendars, with many users and calendars (use existing test data if required)
# [Enable detailed SQL logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Enabling+Detailed+SQL+Logging]
# Log in to Confluence and go to Calendars
# Click to Add Calendar
# Select Existing Calendar
# Enter part of the name of an existing calendar
# Tail the confluence log - you will see many lines like this:
{code}
2014-01-28 00:47:05,045 TRACE [http-10523-13] [sf.hibernate.type.StringType] nullSafeGet returning 'fc72b896-a4d1-44ff-b164-7715a9f2e3e9' as column: x0_0_
{code}
# After 2 minutes, the front end will time out and say "No results found for .."
# Keep watching the logs. After around 6 minutes total on my instance, the logging stopped.

NB: Without detailed SQL logging enabled these requests complete and calendars can be found and added, however I'm concerned this is simply highlighting a larger performance issue that should be investigated. If there is a performance issue, any environmental latency could cause the above timeout, or just very slow calendar retrieval.
fields.summary: Searching for an existing calendar to add is slow and appears to execute many SQL statements when SQL Logging is enabled, potentially causing the request to time out.
Bamboo plan is failed because of caching API is changed on Confluence 5.5-SNAPSHOT
Get rid of the status field from the event macro

fields.summary: Stack trace when downgrading from TC4 to TC 3.2.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49582].
  {panel}

h3. Step to reproduce.
# Add a new event into a c alendar.
# Set the year in the *where* field to something like '0214'
# Ok and save the event.


h3. Expected
The event in calendar is loaded as usual.


h3. Observered Result
None of the event in the calendar will be able to finnish loading
fields.summary: Team  Calendar Loads forever when there is an invalid year added into the event.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49578].
  {panel}

When using the Team Calendars Macro on a page the Internet Explorer 8 crashes. The IE starts to freeze and it affects the whole browser (not only one tab).
It does not crash on Google Chrome (Version 34.0) Opera 12.11 (Pesto-Engine)

We are working on a Confluence-Upgrade, but it is currently not possible, as well as to use a later version of Internet Explorer 8. Therefore a fix would be appreciated.

Thanks for your help in advance
Best regards
Chris
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 8 crashes with Confluence Team calendar macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49572].
  {panel}

When using the Team Calendar macro and putting it in month view. If you try to create an event then set a repeat for that event and try to enter an 'until' end date for that repeat event. When you click in the until entry box - it does not access the calendar date picker (i.e it does not pull up the date picker calendar so you can pick the date that the repeat will stop).

This is the same for any repeat setting you pick. 

As a workaround you can still enter the date as a sting of numbers, with the day first. But would be great if you could fix this minor issue. 

Thanks,
Daniel
fields.summary: Using the repeat feature for an event and trying to set an 'until' end date - does not access calendar date picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49571].
  {panel}

I am having trouble searching for and adding a few already built Calendars. I can add new calendars without issue, but when I add the Team Calendar macro to a page and then in the macro try and add a new calendar by searching for it, nothing shows up. I have view access on all the calendars I am trying to add, so that should not be causing the problem. 

I can not find the calendars from the Team Calendar Macro and I can't search from my personal calendar page either - both searches come back blank, as if the Calendars do not exist, however for the new calendar can be seen on my personal calendar page (but if I delete it here, I still cant find it from the search option here for adding new calendars).

This seems to be happening only for new calendars, all the older calendars I added a long time ago are working and showing up. 

Please help, I cant use the calendars at all, if I or anyone else can not add the calendars we have created anywhere. 

Thanks,
Daniel
fields.summary: Can not search for calendars

fields.summary: User can not be selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49567].
  {panel}

When attempting to load calendars, any one with only an Events selection will not display. The blank calendar appears but not the content. 

For calendars with other types of items (i.e. Travel or Leave), those items will display but Events will not.

When attempting to load Events an animated spinner appears next to the Month button in the upper right to indicate processing. It never stops.

The tomcat log, catalina.out, displays severe errors possibly related to Teamcal however the timing does not seem related to requests to display or add items to the calendar.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49558].
  {panel}

*Description*
If you include Team Calendar macro in Confluence page, and when you set it to list view, the start date and end date displayed wrongly, if the event was set for one month long.

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a people calendar if you don't have any.
# Create an event to any user, and set the event to be more than one month long (e.g. 4th of April to 5th of May)
# Go to a random Confluence space
# Create a new page
# Embed Team Calendars macro (Select a people calendar)
# Select list view
# Save the page
# Click the event

*Expected Result*
The event start date and end date would be correct, for example if you set it to 4th of April to 5th of May it should show as "4 April - 5 May"

*Current Result*
The timing would be wrong, it will be shown on the same month. For example if you set it from 4th of April to 5th of May will be shown as "4 May - 5 May"

  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Use IE8
# Create a page with a Team Calendars macro in list form
# Add enough new lines to push the macro down off the immediately visible page (ie, you should end up with a full page of new lines)
# Click on the tools menu, and browse down to another menu item

*Expected Results:*
The menu should work as normal.

*Actual Results:*
The menu disappears as soon as you mouse over any menu item.

*Workaround:* 
Use 'Month' view instead of list view.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49538].
  {panel}

Customers who are running Confluence 4.3.x (and potentially other versions of Confluence) are finding that their indexing becomes broken when Team Calendars v3.2.3 is enabled in their instance. The index appears to run successful but refreshing the page suggests that the Index isn't rebuilt, even though they have just run the process.

h3. Symptoms
# Index is not working
# Can not create new spaces

Looking in the atlassian-confluence logs, a very distinct error is shown:

{noformat}
2013-06-13 13:50:05,471 ERROR [Indexer: 8] [confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch] indexCollection Error indexing document
 -- referer: http://localhost:6430/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /admin/reindex.action | userName: admin | action: reindex
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.atlassian.confluence.index.Lucene29FieldDescriptorMapper
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.impl.Lucene29AdaptingExtractor.<init>(Lucene29AdaptingExtractor.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.impl.Lucene29ExtractorFactory.convert(Lucene29ExtractorFactory.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.labs.lucenecompat.spring.DynamicExtractorModuleDescriptorsFactory$CompatibilityExtractor.addFields(DynamicExtractorModuleDescriptorsFactory.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.search.BaseDocumentBuilder.getDocument(BaseDocumentBuilder.java:104)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ConfluenceDocumentBuilder.getDocument(ConfluenceDocumentBuilder.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.AddDocumentIndexTask.perform(AddDocumentIndexTask.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.index.TempIndexWriter.perform(TempIndexWriter.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.TempIndexWriterStrategy.perform(TempIndexWriterStrategy.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.TempIndexBackedIndexTaskPerformer.perform(TempIndexBackedIndexTaskPerformer.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.indexCollection(ReindexWorkBatch.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch$1.doInTransaction(ReindexWorkBatch.java:86)
	at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.ReindexWorkBatch.run(ReindexWorkBatch.java:56)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:439)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{noformat}

h3. Resolution
# Upgrade the plugin to v3.2.4 or above, which can be downloaded here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars
# Reindex your instance following these instructions: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration
fields.summary: Confluence stops indexing after upgrading Team Calendars plugin to v3.2.3

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49524].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new event
# Type the event name under "What" field
# Click the "Repeat" drop down menu
# Press the arrows (up or down) to choose the drop down item (example: Weekly)
# Press ENTER on Weekly Repeat (do NOT click with mouse to choose this)

h4. Expected Results
"Repeat every xx month/week/year/day" field is shown

h4. Actual Results
*IE 8.0.7 with Confluence 4.3.7*
Once ENTER is pressed, the event is created and a new "Create Event" box is shown (with the same values as previously entered, except that it's only a one day event). As a result, there are two events are created, as seen from the screenshot below. One is the repeat event and the other is the 1 day event. 
!double-events.png!

*IE 8 (with Confluence 5.1), IE 9 and Firefox 20*
Pressing ENTER will trigger the event to be created

*Chrome 26.0.1410.64 m*
Pressing ENTER will NOT trigger the event to be created. The "Repeat every xx month/week/year/day" field is shown instead

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49520].
  {panel}

UPM 2.9 introduces the ability to purchase add-ons for OnDemand customers, directly from inside the application.

However, Team Calendars has a custom popup to appear once the plugin is found to be licensed. With 2.9, we noticed that this popup can appear multiple times, happens overlaid on top of our progress bar, and covers up vital information.

Can we replace it with the standard {{post.install.url}} to keep it consistent with other add-ons?

http://screencast.com/t/4Aco4zCP - see the very end of the purchase flow. It only happens twice in this video but we've seen it happen more than that as well.

/cc [~smansour], [~merickson]
fields.summary: Multiple "Team Calendars Has Been Installed" popups appear when purchasing Team Calendars through UPM 2.9 OnDemand

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49516].
  {panel}

h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a few reoccurring event in the team calendar on in the same days.
# View the team calendar in Timeline view
# Try moving the left and right in the timeline view.

h3. Observed Result. 
The event will overlap each other hiding some existing event. 

*Extra note*
Please watch the [attached video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/118699/Timeline%20view%20doesn%27t%20show%20all%20events.mp4]  for the exact step to replicate the issue. You may skip to 5.31 in the video to see the reported behavior.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49513].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Install Polls for Confluence
# Add the team calendars macro to a page
# Create an event for the calendar, and click on either of the dates for the 'When' field

Note that the date picker doesn't appear.

This doesn't affect events added via calendar/mycalendar.action

*Notes:*

I thought originally that this was a problem with Polls for Confluence, but I embedded a Google calendar on my page and was still able to bring up it's date picker when Polls was enabled, so I felt it was more sensible to raise the issue here.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49505].
  {panel}

Hello,

I am currently using the Events Calendar as well as the People Calendar and did not notice a way to:
1) Send email notification to an alias when something is added to a calendar
2) Update calendar by sending an email

I am aware that individual people can 'Watch' the calendar but I was wondering how I can sign up a particular alias to send the notification to. In addition, is there a way one can email calendar information to an alias to automatically have that event added to teh calendar?

Thanks,
Parag

  {panel}

Hi, 
we are using JIRA Calendar on Confluence.
we are very happy to use it with convenience,
however, we found that the refreshing of the page cannot work on the update on JIRA issues.
we verified that it can work with a click of "Refresh" of the JIRA Calendar pull-down.
then we have realized that it would be better to update with a click of Refresh, it would be more correct data.

now i want to know the synchronization interval. 
Would you please let me know how long it will be? 
i am looking forward to hearing from you.

Kind regards,

manami

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49494].
  {panel}

There were reports of EAC being unavailable. As per usual it was actually just slow/busy. Checking the GC logs showed the typical pattern we get associated with many outages although this time it actually recovered and started to free memory from the old generation -

!team-cal-gc.png!

Looking at the Simon monitoring in Confluence we see a single request to .../calendar/mycalendar.action with a start time of 20:17:23 and an end time of 20:39:21. Allowing for the difference timezones between us and the server this correlates very closely with the GC "incident".

!TeamCal-wow.png!
